name: superstratum
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
geology
  specialized a layer of rock, soil, or other material that lies on top of another layer: The earth consisted of a layer of strong yellow clay beneath a superstratum of fine loam measuring about ten inches deep.
one of the levels into which something is separated that is above another level: There will always be a superstratum of people who have more rights or power than the rest of us.
More examplesFewer examplesThe earth has a superstratum of soil that rarely exceeds twelve feet in depth, in our climate. Middle-class wage earners have been overtaken by the superstrata of high earners, whose demand has caused home prices to soar.
